segments.text: I see the garden outside the window, so calm and tidy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a contrast to the chaos happening inside the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes and not noticing anything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sorry for her, so absorbed in her task that she misses everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking cookies right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they realize how much trouble they could get into if she catches them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really stretching to reach that cookie jar, and it looks like he might fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn't hurt himself; it would be such a shame.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting patiently, her hand outstretched, hoping for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she's just as caught up in the moment as her brother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is so full of little moments that make me feel a bit melancholy.
segments.speaker: PAR
